newsitem.title: BELARUS: Gazprom head says next ADS sale after 6-7 months.
newsitem.headline: Gazprom head says next ADS sale after 6-7 months.

text.p: Russia's RAO Gazprom will wait at least six to seven months before selling the next tranche of its American Depositary Shares, president Rem Vyakhirev said on Wednesday.

Vyakhirev, speaking at a ceremony to open a section of natural gas pipeline that will bring Russian supplies to Europe via the former Soviet republic of Belarus, said that the market price of Gazprom shares was too low.
"Political instability in Russia has affected the shares, and for investors, the price of instability is very important," he said.

A Gazprom official who declined to be identified said that Gazprom would seek to sell its shares at a price three to four times higher next time around, with each share commanding a price of no less than $5.0.
Gazprom ADS's were quoted at $19.475 at 1238 GMT in London, off highs of $19.825 but above Tuesday's close of $18.50.
Each ADS, which represents 10 underlying shares, was initially priced at $15.75 late on Monday.
The official's comment would price each ADR at around $50.
Vyakhirev said that the London Stock Exchange was scheduled to start trading the paper on October 28.
